intro: Dimeria woodrowii, commonly known as the Woodrow's dimeria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Capparaceae. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. Native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
